text.p: Here are highlights from Polish newspapers this morning.
FRONT PAGE POLITICAL NEWS.
DZIENNIK PRAWA I GOSPODARKI

- Around 25 percent of Poles support the ex-communist Democratic Left Alliance (SLD), 20 percent favour the rightwing Solidarity Electoral Action (AWS), 13 percent support the centrist Union for Freedom (UW), 12 percent are ready to vote for the Polish Peasants Party (PSL) and 10 percent favour the nationalist rightwing Movement for the Reconstruction of Poland (ROP), an April survey by the Demoskop polling agency said.
- The cabinet will discuss a modernisation and reconstruction programme for the armed forces in up to eight weeks time, Prime Minister Wlodzimierz Cimoszewicz said.
ECONOMIC AND MARKET STORIES.
RZECZPOSPOLITA

- The government has drafted a new banking law bill and will pass it on for approval by parliament, the finance ministry said. The new law will improve control over the sector and prevent money laundering, officials of the National Bank of Poland (NBP), the central bank, and the finance ministry said.
- Parliament will vote on the first of a group of bills related to the social insurance system reform at this week's session.

- Poland's parliamentary foreign trade committee has demanded that the government and the central bank produce a coherent and complex foreign trade strategy document and present it to parliament by May 31, the committee said.
- The ABB Zamech Poland energy industry equipment maker increased sales by 33 percent last year, the company said.
- The listed Espebepe construction firm could be saved from bankruptcy only through a 95 percent debt write-off by the biggest creditors, Espebepe said.

- The cabinet's recently produced bill on investment funds is an improvement on the current law and has already been approved by the Polish Securities Commission (KPW) and the European Integration committee (KIE), Pioneer fund's deputy president Marek Zytniewski said.
- Poland's export credit insurance corporation (KUKE) has been awarded observer-member status by the Berne Union of international investment and credit assurers.
- In the first three months of this year the deposits of Hypo Bank Polska grew by 22 million zlotys from 40 million zlotys at the end of 1996, its president Joerg Dorka said.
DZIENNIK PRAWA I GOSPODARKI
- The Polish State Railways (PKP) and Swissrail are planning to start production of locomotives and rail buses in Poland, PKP board president Adam Wieladek said.

- Poland's biggest oil refinery Petrochemia Plock will invest $1.9 billion in modernisation and development to enhance product quality and ready the plant for competition when the fuels market opens in 2.5 years, the company said.
GAZETA WYBORCZA

- A ruling on import deposits introduced by the Czech republic will hit Polish furniture and household durables exporters and spur Poland's trade deficit with the country, Market Economy Research Institute analyst Miroslaw Gronicki said.
ZYCIE

- Fiat Auto Poland introduced a new three-door Uno passenger car model with a 1.0 litre engine priced at 23,900 zlotys and added air-cushions to the standard versions of the Bravo/Brava models made in Poland in April, the company said.
PARKIET
- Poland's privatisation revenues will reach 4.45 billion zlotys in 1997. Only four percent of the above was earned in the first three months of this year, the treasury ministry said.
